reviewText: I have NOT gotten around to contacting the seller yet as I was so distressed & just plain bummed out at what I had so stupidly purchased. I think I will have to sell it so someone outside the good ole USA for them to enjoy.Now I must shop the web for another LA LAW & THIS TIME make sure that the discription says that it can play in the USA.Long story short..... buyer beware & for god sake READ READ READ carefully at what your about to purchase.... especially DVD'S!!
summary: I was under the impression that this would play in CALIFORNIA.... it didn't

reviewText: As one of the top shows of the 1980's i was relieved to see this finally come to DVD, after having last seeing it on A&E  in the mornings before Law & Order reruns.  this show still holds up today, great acting, great story lines, really takes me back to thursday nights in the 80's, any fan of the 80's needs this stat!!

reviewText: Last year, I was tickled pink to finally see Sesaon 1 of this excellent television series on DVD. I have continued to check for its availability every month since and was delighted when Season 2 came out. While Amazon lists it as being a UK format, I contacted the seller and was assured that it would play on DVD players in the U.S.My package arrived in just three days and I watched the first two episodes that night. No problem with the format and I am looking forward to watching some more episodes today -- March 24 -- my birthday!Season 3 is now also available, so that purchase is in my immediate future!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Fantastic to see that the second series (1987/1988) of LA LAW is out less than five months after series 1. A worldwide first and all 20 episodes can be found on this discset!1 - "The Lung Goodbye"2 - "The Wizard of Odds"3 - "Cannon of Ethics"4 - "Brackman Vasektimized"5 - "The Brothers Grimm"6 - "Auld L'Anxiety"7 - "Rohner vs. Gradinger"8 - "Goldilocks and the Three Barristers"9 - "Divorce with Extreme Prejudice"10 - "Full Marital Jacket"11 - "Gorilla My Dreams"12 - "Hand Roll Express"13 - "Beauty and Obese"14 - "Pettycoat Injunction"15 - "The Bald Ones"16 - "Fetus Completus"17 - "Belle of the Bald"18 - "Open Heart Perjury"19 - "Leapin' Lizards!"20 - "Chariots of Meyer"Returning stars from the first series we have Harry Hamlin, Susan Dey, Corbin Bernsen, Jimmy Smits, Jill Eikenberry, Alan Rachins, Michele Greene, Michael Tucker, Susan Ruttan and Richard A Dysart. Debuting in this series we see Blair Underwood join the cast as Jonathan Rollins and Larry Drake as Benny Stulwitz.Well that's two down and eight more to go! Hopefully the whole series will be out by the end of next year! Thank you Revelation Films for making this release happen. I expected that the chances of LA LAW ever being released were nil.Looking forward to series 3!
summary: Welcome Jonathan Rollins - More 80s legal stuff in LA
Title: N/A

reviewText: I purchased mine from Shout Factory.  I say this because mine is Closed Captioned and I needed that for my family.  Love LA Law.  My husband and I watched it when it was broadcast in the late 80's.  For those of you who are critical of the quality, I think it is great.  The quality of a TV show in the 80's is far from what we have today.  Therefore, you can't expect to have the quality of a new show like Blue Bloods. Actually I thought Season 2 had better quality than Season 1.The cast is great.  Jill Eikenberry & Michael Tucker are married in real life and they add some spice to the show.  Ms. Eikenberry starred in Dominick Donne's "An Inconvenient Woman" and was superb.  If you can ever find it buy it.As for LA Law, Corbin Bernsen is still trying to have relationships with as many women as possible; a new associate is hired who causes consternation among the other associates; the mentally challenged man who was the subject of a criminal case was hired as errand boy;  Ms. Eikenberry finds out that the man she defended is actually the true killer; Roxanne is in trouble because of insider trading; A marriage is in the works; Susan Dey is putting criminals behind bars; and Douglas Brackman is now a part time Judge and discovers he has a brother, maybe two brothers.  Will Douglas have an affair with his bailiff?Great show, Closed captioned (at least mine is) and the quality is great.  Plays perfectly in my Sony play only dvd player.  It plays perfect in my Blu-Ray also but you do not receive Closed Captioning with the Blu Ray as the HDMI cable does not support CC.I am looking forward to the rest of the seasons.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a TV on DVD reviewer and was very excited to start watching my review copy of "Law" S1 and even more excited to see S2 coming up so close; the pastel walls, consistent Miami Vice garb w/ huge shoulder pads, and disappointingly bad acting were all tough to see.This is not to mention the weaker-than-recalled plots and less-attractive than remembered cast.It seems that one is better off going with the "Law and Order" franchise,
